## different types of plotting methods
```{r plots}
df$Hosp<-as.factor(df$Hosp)
pal=colorFactor(topo.colors(9),df$Hosp)

n<-leaflet(data=df) %>%
  setView(12.6,55.7,8) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addMarkers(df$Lon, df$Latitude, popup = paste("Hosp=",df$Hosp)) #%>%
  #addCircles(radius=15000, fillOpacity = .2,fillColor = ~pal(df$Hosp)) #addcircle specify distance

n
#plot using simple features by region names
plot(DKnuts3_sf["NUTS_NAME"])

#ggplot with simple features
#colour by NUTS
ggplot(data=DKnuts3_sf,aes(fill=NUTS_NAME))+geom_sf()

#plot with mapview for html, using leaflet
mapview(DKnuts3_sf["NUTS_NAME"]) 



```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
